items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: It's a movie of such jaw-dropping violence, wild improbability and dazzling style it overpowers all resistance.

items.author: Michael Atkinson
items.content: Whatever its oversteps and excesses (I do think Park ran a little amok with the computer gimcrackery), Oldboy has the bulldozing nerve and full-blooded passion of a classic.

items.author: Peter Travers
items.content: As always with Park Chanwook, you just hold on and let him rip.

items.author: Glenn Kenny
items.content: Once the picture gets into Hollywood's bloodstream, it could well prove to be as influential as John Woo's 1989 crime thriller, "The Killer."

items.author: Derek Elley
items.content: A wild, intensely cinematic ride into two men's burning desire to get even.

items.author: Scott Tobias
items.content: The result is a powerfully visceral experience that justifies itself almost entirely on surface chops, with striking color composition and a complex sound design that elevates the story to an operatic scale.

items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: Regardless of how you look at Oldboy, it's unlike anything you are likely to have seen before.

items.author: Anthony Lane
items.content: Oldboy has the fatal air of wanting so desperately to be a cult movie that it forgets to present itself as a coherent one.

items.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum
items.content: Oldboy caused a love-it-or-hate-it stir at Cannes last year, and how could it not: It's an onslaught made to cause a sensation. Consider me simultaneously jolted and depressed.
Put simply, in my humble opinion, Oldboy sucks.
